description: Rays, and possibly sharks, could suffer reproductive loss from being dragged around by fishing nets before being released
title: Pregnant rays tangled in trawler nets have small, sickly babies

author: BBC News
description: A fishing ban extension is said to be the best hope for the world's most endangered marine species.
title: Rare Mexican porpoise faces 'imminent extinction'

author: Ellen Nakashima, Craig Timberg, Ellen Nakashima, Craig Timberg
description: One former employee said the hacking tool was so powerful it was like “fishing with dynamite.”
title: NSA officials worried about the day its potent hacking tool would get loose. Then it did.

author: Ashley May
description: The commercial begins with a boy asking about his dead father and ends with a plug for Filet-O-Fish.
title: McDonald’s apologizes for 'insensitive' UK ad about child coping with father's death

author: Ben Doherty
description: Guide for refugees moved to Australian-run transit centre lists sights to see – and where to go for ‘fishing and snorkelling trips’
title: 'Welcome to Lorengau': reality of detention camp on Manus belies holiday-style brochure

author: Gulnaz Khan
description: In the southeast of France, yacht-strewn shores, cliffside towns, and sleepy fishing villages simmer underneath the Mediterranean sun.
title: 7 of the Most Beautiful Towns on the French Riviera

description: Rabbitfish ingest microscopic marine creatures while grazing on algae. Some of them may survive long trips and wreak havoc far from home when the fish defecate
title: Tiny invasive sea creatures hitch a ride in rabbitfish guts

author: Rachel Bishop, Tui Benjamin
description: David Wilks, 46, wasn't fazed when the white pointer shark grabbed his net in its mouth as he fished off the coast of Port Pirie, South Australia
title: Fearless dad-of-five punches and plays tug of war with 10ft-shark

description: Refugees from a war-torn country seek asylum in a small American fishing town, only the country these people are from is America - and the war they are fleeing hasn't happened yet. As the government tries to uncover the truth behind this mysterious migration only one thing is certain: The lives of the people here - both the townspeople and these newcomers - will never be the same.
title: The Crossing - Official Trailer - IGN Video

author: Zlata Rodionova
description: Fast food giant McDonald’s has apologised after upset TV viewers complained its latest advert “exploits childhood bereavement”. The company’s advert features a boy asking his mother questions about his dead father as he struggles to find things he has in common with him. Once they arrive at a McDonald’s restaurant and the boy orders Filet-o-Fish burger, his mother says: “That was your dad’s favourite too.”
title: McDonald's forced to apologise for 'disgusting' advert exploiting childhood bereavement
